DaD.handler

Class FightHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • DaD.handler.FightHandler

  • public class FightHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Clovis on 09/02/2017. Class used to handle fights. When a fight begin we enter this class to handle all events.
    See Also:
    DungeonRoomExitState

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Hero _hero
      Hero that is part of the fight.
      private static FightHandler _instance
      Private instance of class.
      private java.util.ArrayList<MonsterInstance> _monsterList
      ArrayList containing all monsters that are part of the fight.
      private int _turn
      Number of turn, start at 0 and is incremented before each turn.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final FightHandler getInstance()
        Accessor for instance of class.
        Returns:
        FightHandler

      • startFight

        public DungeonRoomExitState startFight(Hero hero,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<MonsterInstance> monsterList)
        Initialize fight by setting attributes values and starting the fightLoop() function.
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero part of the fight
        monsterList - List of MonsterInstance part of the fight
        Returns:
        DungeonRoomExitState

      • fightLoop

        public DungeonRoomExitState fightLoop()
        Function that call heroTurn() and monsterTurn() until either hero or all monsters are dead.
        Returns:
        DungeonRoomExitState

      • endFight

        private DungeonRoomExitState endFight()
        When either hero or all monsters are dead return the appropriate state.

        If hero died return DungeonRoomExitState.HERO_DIED, if all monsters died return DungeonRoomExitState.HERO_SUCCEEDED else return DungeonRoomExitState.HERO_ESCAPED. Only these 3 states exist for the moment.

        Returns:
        DungeonRoomExitState

      • heroTurn

        private void heroTurn()
        Handle hero turn, this is where hero will choose what he wants to do. Hero turn is always happening before monsterTurn().

      • monsterTurn

        private void monsterTurn()
        Handle monster turn, this is where each monster will attack the hero.

      • displayMonsterInformation

        private void displayMonsterInformation(MonsterInstance monster,
                                       int order)
        Display order and monster name, here to help hero to choose which monster he wants to attack.
        Parameters:
        monster - MonsterInstance you want the name to be displayed
        order - Order of the MonsterInstance
        See Also:
        MonsterInstance
